required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Six Week Study Of The Pain Relieving Effects Of Celecoxib 200 Mg Twice Daily Compared To Tramadol 50 Mg Four Times Daily In Patients With Chronic Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: A Six Week Double-Blind, Randomized, Multicenter Comparison Study Of The Analgesic Effectiveness Of Celecoxib 200 Mg BID Compared To Tramadol Hydrochloride 50 Mg QID In Subjects With Chronic Low Back Pain

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the analgesic effectiveness of celecoxib and tramadol in subjects with Chronic Low Back Pain measured by the Numerical Rating Scale (NRS-Pain) at Week 6

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment Responders Based on the Numerical Rating Scale-Pain (NRS-Pain)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Severity of Chronic Low Back Pain as Measured by NRS-Pain
Change From Baseline in Severity of Low Back Pain as Measured by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
Patient's Global Assessment of Disease Activity
Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity
Change From Baseline in Roland-Morris Disability Questionnaire (RMDQ) Total Score
Change From Baseline in Modified Brief Pain Inventory (m-BPI-sf)
Change From Baseline in Medical Outcomes Study (MOS) Sleep Scale
Number of Subjects With Change From Baseline in MOS Optimal Sleep Scale Scores
Change From Baseline in Work Limitations Questionnaire (WLQ)
Patient's Global Evaluation of Study Medication
Patient's Satisfaction Questionnaire (With Pain Relief Scale)
Patient's Satisfaction Questionnaire (With Walking and Bending Ability Scale)
Chronic Low Back Pain Responders Based on VAS, Patient's Global, and RMDQ

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The subject presents with duration of chronic low back pain of > 3 months requiring regular use of analgesics (> 4 days/week), except for acetaminophen which cannot have been the sole analgesic used
Exclusion Criteria:
- The subject has chronic low back pain, which is neurologic in etiology (i.e., radiculopathy, neuropathy, myelopathy)

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.description: 200 mg capsules two times a day (BID) for 6 weeks

group.description: 50 mg capsules four times a day (QID) for 6 weeks

group.description: 200 mg capsules two times a day (BID) for 6 weeks

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Treatment Responders Based on the Numerical Rating Scale-Pain (NRS-Pain)
outcome.description: A subject who met the following criteria was considered as a successful responder at Week 6: completed 6 weeks of treatment with study medication and had a 30% improvement from Baseline to Week 6/ET on the NRS-Pain. NRS-Pain scale assessed the severity of a subject's lower back pain on a scale of 0 (No pain) and 10 (Worst possible pain).
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat = all subjects who were randomized and received at least one dose of study medication. Missing values were imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF).

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: 200 mg capsules two times a day (BID) for 6 weeks

group.title: Tramadol HCL
group.description: 50 mg capsules four times a day (QID) for 6 weeks

measure.title: Treatment Responders Based on the Numerical Rating Scale-Pain (NRS-Pain)
measure.description: A subject who met the following criteria was considered as a successful responder at Week 6: completed 6 weeks of treatment with study medication and had a 30% improvement from Baseline to Week 6/ET on the NRS-Pain. NRS-Pain scale assessed the severity of a subject's lower back pain on a scale of 0 (No pain) and 10 (Worst possible pain).
measure.population: Intent-to-treat = all subjects who were randomized and received at least one dose of study medication. Missing values were imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF).

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Differences in treatment proportions and the 95% confidence interval (CI) around the difference were estimated by calculating the risk difference between the treatment arms using a generalized linear model with treatment and center as factors. A lower 95% CI for the risk difference greater than -0.10 would demonstrate that celecoxib 200 mg BID is not inferior to tramadol hydrochloride 50 mg QID.

analysis.groups_desc: If celecoxib 200 mg BID was found to be non-inferior to tramadol hydrochloride 50 mg QID then the second step was to test the superiority of celecoxib 200 mg BID over tramadol hydrochloride 50 mg QID using a two-sided test of proportions. Differences in proportions were tested using the General Association Test of the Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel (CMH) procedure stratified by center.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Severity of Chronic Low Back Pain as Measured by NRS-Pain
outcome.description: NRS-Pain scale assessed the severity of a subject's lower back pain on a scale of 0 (No pain) and 10 (Worst possible pain). NRS-Pain scale: Change = mean score at Week 6/ET minus mean score at Baseline.
outcome.population: ITT. Missing values were imputed by LOCF. Number of subjects with NRS-Pain scale scores at Baseline and Week 6/ET: celecoxib n=386, tramadol HCl n=385.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: 200 mg capsules two times a day (BID) for 6 weeks

group.title: Tramadol HCL
group.description: 50 mg capsules four times a day (QID) for 6 weeks

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Severity of Chronic Low Back Pain as Measured by NRS-Pain
measure.description: NRS-Pain scale assessed the severity of a subject's lower back pain on a scale of 0 (No pain) and 10 (Worst possible pain). NRS-Pain scale: Change = mean score at Week 6/ET minus mean score at Baseline.
measure.population: ITT. Missing values were imputed by LOCF. Number of subjects with NRS-Pain scale scores at Baseline and Week 6/ET: celecoxib n=386, tramadol HCl n=385.

analysis.groups_desc: The change from Baseline was compared between the two treatment groups using analysis of covariance (ANCOVA), with treatment and center as factors, and Baseline value as a covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: The mean difference reported is the least squares (LS) mean difference.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Severity of Low Back Pain as Measured by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
outcome.description: VAS was a 100 millimeter (mm) scale that subjects used to assess the severity of their lower back pain. Based on the following question, “During the past day, how much back pain did you have?”, the subject was instructed to place a vertical line on the VAS to indicate the magnitude of his/her lower back pain. 0 mm = no pain and 100 mm = worst possible pain. VAS: Change = mean score at Week 6/ET minus mean score at Baseline.
outcome.population: ITT. Missing values were imputed by LOCF. Number of subjects with VAS scores at Baseline and Week 6/ET: celecoxib n=386, tramadol HCl n=385.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: 200 mg capsules two times a day (BID) for 6 weeks

group.title: Tramadol HCL
group.description: 50 mg capsules four times a day (QID) for 6 weeks

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Severity of Low Back Pain as Measured by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
measure.description: VAS was a 100 millimeter (mm) scale that subjects used to assess the severity of their lower back pain. Based on the following question, “During the past day, how much back pain did you have?”, the subject was instructed to place a vertical line on the VAS to indicate the magnitude of his/her lower back pain. 0 mm = no pain and 100 mm = worst possible pain. VAS: Change = mean score at Week 6/ET minus mean score at Baseline.
measure.population: ITT. Missing values were imputed by LOCF. Number of subjects with VAS scores at Baseline and Week 6/ET: celecoxib n=386, tramadol HCl n=385.

analysis.groups_desc: The change from Baseline was compared between the two treatment groups using ANCOVA, with treatment and center as factors, and Baseline value as a covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: The mean difference reported is the LS mean difference.

outcome.title: Patient's Global Assessment of Disease Activity
outcome.description: Number of subjects with a graded level of disease activity using the Patient’s Global Assessment of Disease Activity 5-point scale (1=very good, 2=good, 3=fair, 4=poor, and 5=very poor). Subjects were classified as "Improved" if their assessment reduced at least 2 grades from baseline or if their assessment changed to Grade 1 (Very Good). Subjects were classified as "Worsened" if their assessment increased at least 2 grades from baseline or if their assessment changed to Grade 5 (Very Poor). Subjects were classified as "No Change" otherwise.
outcome.population: ITT. Number of subjects with Patient's Global Assessment of Disease Activity scores at Week 6/ET: celecoxib n=375, tramadol HCl n=367.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: 200 mg capsules two times a day (BID) for 6 weeks

group.title: Tramadol HCL
group.description: 50 mg capsules four times a day (QID) for 6 weeks

measure.title: Patient's Global Assessment of Disease Activity
measure.description: Number of subjects with a graded level of disease activity using the Patient’s Global Assessment of Disease Activity 5-point scale (1=very good, 2=good, 3=fair, 4=poor, and 5=very poor). Subjects were classified as "Improved" if their assessment reduced at least 2 grades from baseline or if their assessment changed to Grade 1 (Very Good). Subjects were classified as "Worsened" if their assessment increased at least 2 grades from baseline or if their assessment changed to Grade 5 (Very Poor). Subjects were classified as "No Change" otherwise.
measure.population: ITT. Number of subjects with Patient's Global Assessment of Disease Activity scores at Week 6/ET: celecoxib n=375, tramadol HCl n=367.

analysis.groups_desc: CMH tests using row mean score and adjusted for center was used to compare the two treatment groups.

outcome.title: Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity
outcome.description: Number of subjects with a physician's grading of disease activity using the Physician’s Global Assessment of Disease Activity 5-point scale ((1=very good, 2=good, 3=fair, 4=poor, and 5=very poor). Subjects were classified as "Improved" if their assessment reduced at least 2 grades from baseline or if their assessment changed to Grade 1 (Very Good). Subjects were classified as "Worsened" if their assessment increased at least 2 grades from baseline or if their assessment changed to Grade 5 (Very Poor). Subjects were classified as "No Change" otherwise.
outcome.population: ITT. Number of subjects with Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity scores at Week 6/ET: celecoxib n=368, tramadol HCl n=361.

Subjects were classified as "Worsened" if their assessment increased at least 2 grades from baseline or if their assessment changed to Grade 5 (Very Poor). Subjects were classified as "No Change" otherwise.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Roland-Morris Disability Questionnaire (RMDQ) Total Score
outcome.description: Each subject assessed his/her own disability due to low back pain using the RMDQ worksheet, which consisted of 24 statements of disability. The RMDQ total score was calculated as the total number of statements that were checked; the RMDQ total scores could have ranged from 0 to 24, with higher scores indicating greater disability. RMDQ: Change = mean score at Week 6/ET minus mean score at Baseline.
outcome.population: ITT. Missing values were imputed by LOCF. Number of subjects with Roland-Morris Disability total scores at Baseline and Week 6/ET= celecoxib n=391, tramadol n=389.

The RMDQ total score was calculated as the total number of statements that were checked; the RMDQ total scores could have ranged from 0 to 24, with higher scores indicating greater disability. RMDQ: Change = mean score at Week 6/ET minus mean score at Baseline.
measure.population: ITT. Missing values were imputed by LOCF. Number of subjects with Roland-Morris Disability total scores at Baseline and Week 6/ET= celecoxib n=391, tramadol n=389.

analysis.groups_desc: The change from Baseline was compared between the two treatment groups using ANCOVA, with treatment and center as factors, and Baseline value as a covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: The mean difference reported is the LS mean difference.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Modified Brief Pain Inventory (m-BPI-sf)
outcome.description: m-BPI-sf scale assessed pain severity (0 = no pain to 10 = worst possible pain), and pain interference of functional activities (0 = does not interfere to 10 = completely interferes) during the 24 hour follow-up period. Subjects indicated: how much pain now; worst pain; average level of pain; how much pain interfered with general activity, mood, walking ability, relations with other people, sleep, normal work (including housework), and enjoyment of life. m-BPI-sf: Change = mean score at Week 6/ET minus mean score at Baseline.
outcome.population: ITT. Missing values were imputed by LOCF. Number of subjects with m-BPI-sf scores at Baseline and Week 6/ET: celecoxib n=373, tramadol HCl n=367.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Medical Outcomes Study (MOS) Sleep Scale
outcome.description: MOS sleep scale included the following attributes: sleep disturbance, snoring, awaken shortness of breath or headache, quantity of sleep, sleep adequacy, somnolence, Sleep Problem Index I, and Sleep Problem Index II. Score ranged from 0-100, with a higher score indicating more of the scale attribute (e.g., more sleep disturbance, etc.). A negative change indicated subject improvement. MOS sleep scale: Change = mean score at Week 6/ET minus mean score at Baseline.
outcome.population: ITT. Number of subjects with MOS scores at Baseline and Week 6/ET: n=celecoxib, tramadol HCl.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Change From Baseline in MOS Optimal Sleep Scale Scores
outcome.description: The Optimal Scale is scaled from 0 or 1 with 1 indicating 7 or 8 hours of sleep per night and 0 otherwise. Number of subjects with change of improvement (0 to 1), no change (1 to 1 or 0 to 0), or worsening (1 to 0) from baseline as indicated by the MOS Optimal sleep scale.
outcome.population: ITT. Number of subjects with MOS Optimal sleep scale scores at Week 6/ET: celecoxib n=373, tramadol HCl n=365.

group.description: 200 mg capsules two times a day (BID) for 6 weeks

analysis.groups_desc: Optimal sleep was analyzed using CMH general association test.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Work Limitations Questionnaire (WLQ)
outcome.description: The WLQ included the following: Time Scale, Physical Scale, Output Scale, Mental-Interpersonal Scale, and Index Scale. The scales ranged from 0 (Limited none of the time) to 100 (Limited all of the time). A negative change indicated subject improvement.
outcome.population: ITT. Number of subjects with WLQ scores at Baseline and Week 6/ET: n=celecoxib, tramadol HCl.

outcome.title: Chronic Low Back Pain Responders Based on VAS, Patient's Global, and RMDQ
outcome.description: Subjects were successful responders if they had: > = 30% improvement from baseline to final visit in VAS assessment (as identified by 100 millimeter scale); > = 30% improvement from baseline to final visit in Patient's Global assessment (classified as improved if assessment reduced at least 2 grades from baseline or if assessment changed to Grade 1, worsened if assessment increased at least 2 grades from baseline or if assessment changed to Grade 5, or no change; and < 20% worsening from baseline to final visit in RMDQ assessment (lower scores indicated greater disability).

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: 200 mg capsules two times a day (BID) for 6 weeks

group.title: Tramadol HCL
group.description: 50 mg capsules four times a day (QID) for 6 weeks

measure.title: Chronic Low Back Pain Responders Based on VAS, Patient's Global, and RMDQ
measure.description: Subjects were successful responders if they had: > = 30% improvement from baseline to final visit in VAS assessment (as identified by 100 millimeter scale); > = 30% improvement from baseline to final visit in Patient's Global assessment (classified as improved if assessment reduced at least 2 grades from baseline or if assessment changed to Grade 1, worsened if assessment increased at least 2 grades from baseline or if assessment changed to Grade 5, or no change; and < 20% worsening from baseline to final visit in RMDQ assessment (lower scores indicated greater disability).

analysis.groups_desc: CMH test adjusted for center was used to compare the two treatment groups.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
